intro: Lucaea typica, commonly known as the typical lucaea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Lucaea typica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
